attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description: Verification of cash at the cash office revealed minimal material variances.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should maintain the controls in place at the cash office.
attributes.effect: Effective controls in place as evidenced by the immaterial variances.

value: This is well noted
Well noted
In the prior audit on 16th Dec 2025, It was noted that the cashier accounted for all the cash balance.
Current
Verification of cash held at the cash office was done on 19th February 2025, to confirm cash held by the cashier and whether the set cash operation standards are adhered to
The branch cashier should maintain the controls in place.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure cash transactions in the branch are properly accounted for

attributes.title: Bread weight
attributes.description: Weighing bread to ensure bread dispatched to the market meet the required weight standards.
attributes.recommendation: Unpacked bread should be weighed before packing to ensure no underweight bread are dispatched to the market.
attributes.effect: Presence of underweight bread is an indication that the company is exposed to financial and reputational risks in form of penalties and customer dissatisfaction respectively.

value: We shall closely monitor bread cycle to ensure that weight of the final product meets the set standards particularly the cooling time.

Dividing ranges are ok. There is an issue with one oven MBN 192 with faulty elements hence increasing the baking time which again results in to excess moisture loss affecting the weight of the final product.
In the previous audit, Bread underweights were observed on 400ctw, 400 Grande, 400 Akiyda and 800 CTW.
Current
Bread underweight percentages were noted as follows; 400g CT - 35%, 400g Grande – 9%, 400g Akiyda – 31%, 600g BT - 21%, 800g CTW - 15% while 1.5kg W had 36%.
The branch management should ensure the set production standards are adhered to ensure the final product dispatched to the market is of the correct weight
Operations/Production Department
Eliminate cases of underweight bread

attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description: Physical stock counted compared to the SAP balances had variations as follows; Bread had a -32.75 loaves, Utto had -0.761 Litres, white flour had -5.075 kgs, and poly bags had +547 pcs. The rest of the stock items had minimal variances.
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should maintain the stock controls in place.

value: To continue ensuring that all stock items are properly accounted for.
I will continue conducting regular stock take to ensure stocks are properly accounted for

In the previous audit, it was noted that there were zero or minimal variations between the physical and the book stocks in most items except poly bags which had +230 pieces and bread stock which had a shortfall of -32 loaves
Current
Stock verification to confirm whether the physical stocks balances matches with the inventory in warehouse as at the time of stock take.
Stocks controls in place are good.
Operations/Production Department
Ensure there are no losses associated with stocks discrepancies.

attributes.title: Bread damages
attributes.description: It was noted that production damages were averaging at 0.31% of the production and market damages stood at 0.50% of the total sales
attributes.recommendation: The branch team need to employ adequate controls to manage damages related to production
attributes.effect: Excess production damages recorded for the period exceeded the set threshold exposing the company to a revenue loss of Kshs. 23,929.50

value: We are currently ensuring that we have good tins in rotation to control production damages.
We shall follow up to ensure oven element for MBN 192 are checked so as to control production damages thereof.
In the previous audit on 16th Dec 2024, it was found that production bread damages were averaging at 0.34% of the production damages and market damages stood at 0.95% of the sales.
Current

Analysis of production and market damages was done for the period of 49 days from 1st Jan 2025 to 18th Feb 2025 to determine whether bread damages were within the desired percentages of 0.20% to total production and 0.50% of the total sales
There is need to employ adequate measures to control production damages
Operations/Production Department
To ensure there is quality compromise due to lack of machinery maintenance.

attributes.title: Mixing Charts Analysis
attributes.description: From the analysis, it was noted that the branch average production per day was 44 bags which is 54% of the branch target of 81 bags, Average yield was 190.41 and there were 283 cases of remixes during the period
attributes.recommendation: The sales team need to explore more opportunities to expand the market base and take advantage of the branch production capacity which is currently underutilized
attributes.effect: Failure to meet the set targets implies that the branch production capacity was not fully utilized. 54% achievement in production implies that there was an idle capacity of 46%.

value: Production is tied to the sales
We plan production as per the orders
In previous audit, average production was 47.10 bags per day this represent 58.15% of the set target of 81 bags
Physical mixing charts analysis verification against cashflow and the SAP data, Average yield and production target achievement

The branch is underutilized in terms of production capacity

Raw materials BOM and yield achieved is at the desired level.
Operations/Production Department
To achieve branch  full production capacity utilization and efficient raw materials utilization in achieving the desired yield.

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description: Total outstanding debtors amounted to Kshs. 836,186.45. Most of the balances are for active institutions. Dormant accounts had an outstanding balance of Kshs. 157,337.25
attributes.recommendation: Follow up of the dormant account balances
attributes.effect: Debtor balances can lead to bad debts and hence financial losses.

value: Sales Rep following up on the dormant accounts
Sales rep following on the dormant accounts amounting to Kshs. 157,337.25.
Current
An analysis of the route balances was done as at 20th Feb 2025 to ascertain the status thereof.
Sales Rep should ensure credit payments terms with institutions are strictly adhered to.
Sales Department
Control debtors to avoid cases of bad debts.

attributes.title: Slicing efficiency
attributes.description: Packing efficiency analysis revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 83.68 crates per slicer
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that slicers are hired on need basis and that the set efficiency level is achieved.
attributes.effect: Slicing efficiency of 83.68 crates per slicer implies that the company incurred Kshs 41,040 on extra slicers hired during the period under review

value: We have been pushing our slicers on efficiency and we have seen improvement in the recent past. We shall continue to push to ensure we attain the target of 97 crates per slicer.
Packing efficiency is low in this branch, the manager is tasked to ensure the hired slicers achieve the set target
In the prior audit on 16th Dec 2024, It was noted that average packing efficiency for the sample period was 69.57crates per packer
Analysis of bread packed in the review period against slicers hired to ascertain achieved efficiency.
The 97 crates target per slicer not achieved
Operations/Production Department
Ensure slicing costs aligns with the budgeted costs

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description: From the analysis, it was noted that the production efficiency was 4.37 bags per production worker
attributes.recommendation: The  branch management should keep up with good control on production work force.
attributes.effect: Production workers were well controlled hence no extra cost incurred through hiring extra workers.

value: We shall maintain controlling the production work force.
The production efficiency level is good and well noted
In the prior audit on 16th Dec 2024, it was noted that the production efficiency was 4.207 bags per production worker
Current

Production efficiency was calculated for a period of 49 days from 1st Jan 2025 to 18th Feb 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.3 bags per worker
The branch management should maintain the controls in place on production workforce
Operations/Production Department
To control production labour cost

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description: Mini shop spot check revealed that sales proceed were properly accounted as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: The branch management is encouraged to keep up with the good stock and cash controls at the mini shop.
attributes.effect: The shop is operated in accordance with the established standards. Adequate controls are in place as there was no stock or cash variances noted.

value: We shall continue to ensure the shop is well run.
The shop is operated well
Current
A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 19th Feb 2025 to assess whether the operation were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
Adequate controls are in place as there was no stock or cash variances noted.
Sales Department
To ensure all deliveries are properly accounted for and that all sales are in cash basis.

attributes.title: Vehicle fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description:
The analysis revealed that fuel consumption for all branch vehicles were within the set standards.

Kangema route vehicle KCZ 370T was in Nairobi for service between 5th to 13th Feb. It covered 539 KM during this period.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should maintain the controls on vehicle fuel consumption.
attributes.effect: Adherence to the set standards implies that there are no cases of fuel overconsumption

value: This is well noted and we shall ensure fuel consumption is well controlled at all time.
Fueling of vehicles is guided by the set standards and the branch should always adhere to the set standards.
In the prior  audit it was noted that one vehicle KCP 760L didn’t meet the set consumption rate with a significant variations while other vehicles missed the set target with marginal variation.
Current
The purpose of this analysis was to assess and analyze the fuel consumption at the branch for the period 1st Feb 2025 to 18th Feb 2025, to evaluate compliance with set fuel standard for each vehicle.
Fuel consumption controls are adequate
Transport/Fleet Department
To ensure that fuel consumption follows the set standards per vehicle.
